item.title: AWS Xray brain dump
item.author: vinod@kurup.com (Vinod Kurup, MD)
item.description: These are very rough notes on how I got AWS Xray working in a kubernetes deployment. Posting this mainly for my auxiliary brain. First, set up an IAM role that allows nodes to access xray. Following this blog post: https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/compute/application-tracing-on-kubernetes-with-aws-x-ray/ I cloned this repo: https://github.com/aws-samples/aws-xray-kubernetes Build the AWS Xray image: cd xray-daemon/ docker build -t xray-daemon:latest . THIS OUT OF DATE! try this: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/xray/latest/devguide/xray-daemon-ecs.html#xray-daemon-ecs-image Create an AWS ECR repo: aws ecr create-repository --repository-name xray-daemon Login via docker:
